WRITING.TEXT:
Synergy wise, everything is so damn broken with this class.
Our 3 sets each use the helm slot. Most of our powerful class legendaries come from the helm slot too, not to mention andies and the new leoric crown.
It works fine, it's just stupid as hell to play ping pong with your monk
Yeah they're still fairly broken in comparison to the other classes , however, excluding storm breaker, they're the most fun to play
Basically I made the mistake of playing my monk and wizard on the ptr, it's impossible to go back to live after getting a taste of what's to come.
So we'll find out tonight if you married an axe murderer or not. Report back from beyond the grave if you can.
Make sure you check it for ants first.....
You left out the part about quitting your job and playing for hours without end.
Yeah she should be grateful
Thanks for the funny story. Hope your husband is well
OP are you still alive and married?
Start by doubling or trippling spender damage and reworking gimmicky sets.

I'd rather see the current monk class replaced by D2 assassin.
#trapassin
It's a good starter set. If you're in yellows then I would craft the 4 pieces
Diablo's problem in D2? Not enough plot foreshadowing.
It's too bad you couldn't predict monks would be relegated to follower class. 0/10 for this oversight

It's always fun to start fresh. A lot of my friends will be coming back for 2.1, and we'd all like to be on equal footing. All my non season characters are still there, I'm just losing access to my gold/legendaries for a bit, meh.
Blinding flash so I can escape boring work meetings or end arguments with my wife.
The monk results sadden me even more. I imagine it's a lot worse in hardcore too

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone tried new forked lightning with firebird, mykens and velvet?
WRITING.TEXT:
As the title asks, I'm wondering if something like malakai's build, with a weapon other than shard of hate, could proc enormous amounts of the firebird dot?
See his thread here http://us.battle.net/d3/en/forum/topic/12877968041
I won't be able to test this myself for another 8 hours or so. I also don't have the velvet helm yet.
Your monk's templar could probably solo T6 with you as his follower. Glorious!
Deadset you always have the best videos. Straight to the point, filled with gameplay and very informative. Thanks!
I'm loving the new furious charge changes with Raekor set. It's boss when you add IK set to the mix and just frenzy the shit out of everything.

I often run it with high CDR and Vyr's. This allows me to burst down elite packs frequently but the best part is the short black hole cooldown. RoF with black ice rune decimates packs that are black hole'ed. My usual set up is drop first Hydra, black hole and drop 2nd Hydra. This allows their frost novas to stagger.
Again this is HC play. I value high control over fast clearing.

Just wanted to make a quick note about frost Hydra. Double Hydra, the helm that gives them frost nova and the RoF source are indispensable for hardcore play. I run without a signiture spell and comfortably clear T5. Was hoping for a better RoF buff to push me into T6 but we'll see. I'm confident they'll tinker with channeled spells again.
Yes this set up does less damage, but the mob control is amazing for hc.I always get positive feedback in group play.

My double Hydra, ray of frost, and frost nova helm build just got a new lease on life. I can't wait to try this. The damage was lacking after t4, this may do the trick. Frozen things = more time spent channeling
Love the wizard changes!
This is why I don't spend to much time on the ptr.
Skill capped maybe? It happens in a game like this

I love HolyHermit's videos. Great production quality, straight to the point, doesn't waste 20mins of my time, and his builds usually differ from cookie cutter specs (this one is more informational than a specific build). Always look forward to seeing more!
Oh and his voice just adds to it :)

I always view my hardcore deaths as a new beginning. A chance to try something new with another class or gear the same class differently. I play hard and take lots of risks, death never really bothers me. Good luck on your next toon.
Try reducing audio channels. That's made a massive difference when in a group rift. Sometimes I just flat out disable sound and listen to music and it runs even better.

Ladies and gentleman, I present you with probably the only legendary mighty weapon ever worth using. http://us.battle.net/d3/en/item/fury-of-the-vanished-peak Spamming slam non stop with RCR and fire gear is much fun. That being said it's a 2 hander and you lose out on 130% CHD.

It's a fun item but I wouldn't make it the center piece of your spec. I read on the wizard forums that it scales with fire damage. I use swords to plow and grim harvest to up the globes, but I'll be mainly using seismic slam or ancient spear and collect globes when there's a lot.
It's good supplemental damage that helps your party and keeps you topped up. Doubly so if used with reaper wraps.

Hey I run a HF - ascendancy with a FotF and Eberli Charo on my HC Crusader, I easily clear T3 and hoping to move into T4/T5 when I get my last Akkan piece. Would a build using 100% uptime tri-beam HF be viable in T6? I prefer the mid range play using justice and FotH as added damage during the beams to increase my odds of survivability in hardcore. I know shotgun would be better but the positional requirement puts me at great risk of dying.

WRITING.TITLE: Crusader - 100% Uptime Steed Charge - Fun bounties (x-post from r/Diablo3Crusaders)
WRITING.TEXT:
Mainly for those unaware about this fun patch buff. I recently found a [Swiftmount](http://us.battle.net/d3/en/item/swiftmount) flail.
I equipped it, used steed charge with endurance rune, along with frevor and Lord commander passives, with about 42% cooldown reduction you can have 100% uptime. That is, it'll be off cooldown the moment the spell duration ends.
It's really fun and enjoyable when doing quick bounties, you'll be blazing through everything at absurd speeds. When doing normal splits I can usually do 4/5 or 5/5 A2 bounties by the time the other farmers finish A1. I usually roll with Phalanx Bowmen and they can kill things while you're riding around. Same cooldown as steed. Tried it with nightmare rune but the little cooldown was driving me nuts :)
Enjoy!

WRITING.TITLE: 100% Steed Charge Uptime - Fun but useless!
WRITING.TEXT:
Mainly for those unaware about this fun patch buff. I recently found a [Swiftmount](http://us.battle.net/d3/en/item/swiftmount) flail.
I equipped it, used steed charge with endurance rune, along with frevor and Lord commander passives, with about 42% cooldown reduction you can have 100% uptime. That is, it'll be off cooldown the moment the spell duration ends.
It's really fun and enjoyable when doing quick bounties, you'll be blazing through everything at absurd speeds. When doing normal splits I can usually do 4/5 or 5/5 A2 bounties by the time the other farmers finish A1. I usually roll with Phalanx Bowmen and they can kill things while you're riding around. Same cooldown as steed. Tried it with nightmare rune but the little cooldown was driving me nuts :)
Enjoy!

WRITING.TITLE: 2.0.5 Cinder Switch viable now?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all,
So I was checking this guide http://www.diablofans.com/forums/diablo-iii-class-forums/crusader-the-church-of-zakarum/88054-fiery-hammers-power-of-furnace-t6-fire-hammerdin about a fire crusader and there was mention of maybe using the newly buffed cinder switch instead of a furnace. I was just wondering if anyone has experimented with it yet? The 250% dmg at a potential 50% proc seems like it would be good. I have the plan but I'm currently lacking the materials.
since vanilla, I've highly enjoyed being a pet doctor, then they became FOTM and I've stopped playing it. It's toi easy and too boring with all the recent buffs.

WRITING.TITLE: FotF +Eberli Charo build?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all
So after losing my first crusader to an unfortunate DC on hardcore I decided to make another because I found a FotF while playing on my monk. After being 70 for 2 hours I had an Eberli Charo drop. I was wondering if there's any good build choices that combines these 2 items? Or should I stick to a holy shotgun build?
Thanks
Quick question, would +elite dmg from aughilds and sun keeper apply to pets?
Wait I just thought of something. With the split game method, the bounties earned after hitting 70 would all be T6 cache rewards, right?
In order to stay safe in hardcore, can the person being power leveled sit in town and just do the banner/tp back to town trick for each bounty completion?
Awesome thanks for the response. I play hardcore and there's always a clanmate in need of power levelling. Will try this next time.

Is one game sufficient to go from 1 to 70? Or would two half clears be better? (1 to 40 then 41 to 70) Also what if the person makes the level 1 game then leaves and brings their 70 to help partially clear bounties?

WRITING.TITLE: Iron Skin doesn't always seem to proc (bug?)
WRITING.TEXT: So I like the playstle of a thorns build. I'm sitting at 18,000 thorns and still working on gearing up. I've been noticing though that iron skin seems a little unreliable at times. I'll use it but the big thorns numbers don't always pop up. It seems like it doesn't always proc. This is especially evident when using the flash rune during fast bounties. I'll pop iron skin, run into a pack, get hit a bunch of times but I don't receive the speed buff increase. Seems to work only half the time. Has anyone else noticed this when using reflective skin or flash?

What build is in the video? It differs from the original one in your old post. I'm currently sitting at 42% CDR and in interested in trying this when I get home. I play HC as well, so pressing cooldowns and running around seems ideal. Wish I had Borne's to craft, would get me in that sweet spot.
From a witch doctor's perspective, tasker Theo gloves offer a significant boost in pet DPS. Probably would be beneficial for your pets as well.
I guess I should aim for LoH, CHC, CHD and thorns since that's a secondary effect now. I wish blizzard would confirm if the pet's CHD was an intended buff. They were quick to hotfix crusaders.

WRITING.TITLE: Playing a WD again, need a little info
WRITING.TEXT:
My first character when D3 vanilla launched was a WD, my first 60 was a WD, my first inferno Diablo kill was with the same WD. I used to run a pet/thorns/life regen build and it was the most fun I had with the class. Sort of a lazy doctor build. Clear speeds on mp6 inferno were reasonably fast. Then I took a long break and I'm just getting back into d3. I noticed my old gear and thorns build wasnt working as well.
What I'd like to know is with the new changes since 2.0 (been out of the loop a bit), is a pet/thorns/regen build still viable at 70? I play HC so diving into higher torments as quickly as possible isn't a priority. Between work, life and my 2 kids, my play is casual. Any tips or info would be greatly appreciated. If thorns isn't viable, then what other pet build that promotes the same time of gameplay would work?
Thanks!

Great read! Happy things worked out.
Although not of the same magnitude, I had similar experiences in high school while playing counter strike with a local group of people.
